wiki.content:
54-46 Was My Number was one of the first ska songs to receive widespread popularity outside Jamaica and is seen as being one of the defining songs of the reggae genre. It has been anthologized repeatedly and the titles of several reggae anthologies include "54-46" in their title.
 
 The lyrics describe Toots' time in prison for an arrest for possession of marijuana. The song features the same riddim as "Train to Skaville" by Toots & the Maytals' contemporaries The Ethiopians.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: 54-46 Was My Number was one of the first ska songs to receive widespread popularity outside Jamaica and is seen as being one of the defining songs of the reggae genre. It has been anthologized repeatedly and the titles of several reggae anthologies include "54-46" in their title.  The lyrics describe Toots' time in prison for an arrest for possession of marijuana. The song features the same riddim as "Train to Skaville" by Toots & the Maytals' contemporaries The Ethiopians.

track.name: 54-46 Was My Number
comments: This is real rude boy music
i got to have dinner with toots to me it was like having dinner with jesus
Always puts a smile on my face... glad I heard this today!
